chapter.title: Managing Client Machines with ⪪
chapter.para: ⪪ lets you register and manage client machines on &scc;. Client machines must be configured to use ⪪. For information about configuring clients to use ⪪, see .

sect1.title: Listing Registered Clients
sect1.para: To list ⪪-registered client machines, use the smt-list-registrations command. The following information is listed for each client: its Unique ID, Hostname, date and time of Last Contact with the ⪪ server, and the Software Product the client uses.

sect1.title: Manual Registration of Clients at &scc;
sect1.para: The smt-register command registers clients at &scc;. This registers all unregistered clients and clients with data that changed since the last registration.
To register clients whose registration has failed, use the --reseterror option. This option resets the SCC registration error flag and tries to submit registrations again.

sect1.title: Scheduling Periodic Registrations of Clients at &scc;
sect1.para: ⪪ module allows for the easy scheduling of client registrations. By default, registrations are scheduled to run every 15 minutes. To create or modify a new registration schedule, follow the steps below.

step.para: Select any SCC Registration job and click Edit to change its schedule.
To create a new registration schedule, click Add and select SCC Registration as Job to Run.
Choose the Frequency of the scheduled ⪪ job. You can perform jobs Daily, Weekly, Monthly, or Periodically (every n-th hour or every m-th minute).
Set the Job Start Time by entering the Hour and Minute or appropriate time periods. For weekly and monthly schedules, select the Day of the Week or the Day of the Month the mirroring should occur.

note.title: Lowest Registration Frequency
note.para: Do not set the frequency lower than 10 minutes, because the maximum value of the rndRegister is 450 (7.5 minutes). If the frequency is lower, it may happen that the started process is still sleeping when the next process starts. This causes the second request to exit.

step.para: Click OK or Add and Finish.

sect1.para: Scheduling of ⪪ jobs in general is covered in .
&yast; uses cron to schedule &scc; registrations and other ⪪ jobs. If you prefer not to use &yast;, you can use cron directly.
To disable automatic registration, change the forwardRegistration value in the [LOCAL] section of the /etc/smt.conf configuration file to false.

sect1.title: Compliance Monitoring
sect1.para: To assist customers in monitoring their license compliance, ⪪ generates a weekly report based on data from ⪪ and &scc;. This report contains information about statistics of the registered machines, products used, and of the active, expiring or missing license subscriptions. If subscriptions are about to expire and/or more &sle; machines are registered than you have purchased licenses for, the report contains relevant warnings.
To calculate the compliance, the smt-report tool by default downloads information about the subscriptions and registrations (this can be disabled).

You can configure the recipient addresses for the reports in the Database and Reporting section of the &yast; Subscription Management Tool configuration module. All of the e-mail configuration options are located in the [REPORT] section of /etc/smt.conf and explained in .
The scheduling of the reports is configured in /etc/cron.d/novell.com-smt, while the parameters to use with the cron jobs are in the REPORT_PARAMS section of /etc/smt.d/smt-cron.conf.

Describing the content of the reports is beyond the scope of this section, but a set of reports can be split into five individual parts. By default, these reports are attached as individual files to the mail on the weekly report run. The alerts report is a normal text file while the others are in CSV format. The reports can also be created in PDF or XML by specifying --pdf or --xml as output format.
